page.title: 11HOUSING in Withington page 1
page.content: Except within the village of Withington all housing is very scattered, being mostly built as {farms, cottages and smallholdings.}The number of original farm houses totals about 36, but only half of these are working farms today, and three are market gardens. The remaining, together with some farm cottages and smallholdings, a chapel and the old school, have been purchased by professional people wanting{a home in {the country.}Such former farms often retain 8 or 9 acres for keeping horses or a few sheep while the rest of the land is sold or rented to nearby farmers. In Withington village there are approximatly 24{council built dwellings including some 6 bungalows for the elderly. In Catchpenny Lane there are 18 council built houses,
